Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The notarisations dont propagate to every single node at teh same time, so if block happens quite fast (which is ALL THE TIME on PoS64 chains) then its possible a notarisation can be confirmed before the last one. So I made it so that if it creates a block with an invalid notarisation it flags the txid as invalid to a static variable. CreateBlock can only be called in lock cs_main so if it tries to create one block and it fails, it then saves the txid, and next time it tries to create the block it adds the out of order notarisation as a normal tx but does not create the coinbase.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So then the block will pass the validation

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not 100% sure its working properly... and ive pushed PoW to 51% and cant find any more blocks lol

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
if anyone is mining these chains please update to lates. 
I dont relly understand why it does what it does ğŸ˜† 
But this is the best thing I can come up with. It will flag the notarisation tx as invalid then create and mine a new block without it, then if for some reason that notarisation is then valid after it mines the block (dont understand how this happens but it did) it will reject that block and try to mine a block with the notarisation again. Really strange... The only other option it so have it not include the notarisation, whcih seems dangerous  for MoMoM we really need every notarisation on chain to prevent gaps.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Allowing the coinbase to pay out for out of order notarisations will screw the coin emission ğŸ˜¦
